definition: (of garments) against the skin/to line/lining/to contrast with/to assist financially

sentences.english: The workers phased the various processes in shirt production.
sentences.chinese: 工人们安排好衬衣生产的各道工序。

sentences.english: After you wiped out the lice from of your husband's and sons' shirts.
sentences.chinese: 在你把夫儿们的衬衣上的虱子一颗颗的掐死之后。

sentences.english: You could see the sweat stain on his white shirt.
sentences.chinese: 他的白衬衣上汗渍斑斑。

sentences.english: My shirt hikes up if I don't wear a belt.
sentences.chinese: 我不束腰带的话，衬衣就会向上滑。
你把我的衬衣都溅湿了。

sentences.english: But I think Such shirts packed in cardboard cartons can save freight cost.
sentences.chinese: 但是我认为使用硬纸箱包装这批衬衣可以节省运费。

sentences.english: The mends on your shirt were almost invisible.
sentences.chinese: 你衬衣上修补的地方简直看不出来。

sentences.english: Another one helped to sew the button onto his shirt.
sentences.chinese: 另一个队员帮他把扣子缝在衬衣上。

sentences.english: Chen is full of sweat with heat so that he has to untie the buttons of blue shirt.
sentences.chinese: 陈老师热得满头大汗，索性将蓝色衬衣的扣子解开。

sentences.english: He went back to the shop and changed that shirt for a larger one.
sentences.chinese: 他返回商店把那件衬衣调换成一件大一些的。

sentences.english: I've mucked up my shirt by working in the garden.
sentences.chinese: 我在花园里工作，把衬衣弄脏了。

sentences.english: His elbow was poking through his torn shirt sleeve.
sentences.chinese: 他的肘伸出了撕破的衬衣袖管。

sentences.english: Shuck your dirty shirt and put on a new one.
sentences.chinese: 把你的脏衬衣脱了，换一件干净的。

sentences.english: A shot rings out, blood spatters the man's shirt, and he falls to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 一声枪响后，血迹沾满了他的衬衣，他应声倒地。

sentences.english: He buttoned the top button of his shirt.
sentences.chinese: 他把衬衣最上面一颗纽扣扣起来。

sentences.english: Soapy's elbow was poling through his torn shirt sleeve.
sentences.chinese: 苏比的胳膊肘从他衬衣的破袖子里露了出来。

definition: collar/neckband/neckline/the place where the two ends of a collar meet
